name: py-medaka

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
medaka is a tool to create consensus sequences and variant calls from
nanopore sequencing data. This task is performed using neural networks
applied a pileup of individual sequencing reads against a draft
assembly. It provides state-of-the-art results outperforming sequence-
graph based methods and signal-based methods, whilst also being faster.

dependencies.name: htslib
dependencies.description: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats.

dependencies.name: minimap2
dependencies.description:
Minimap2 is a versatile sequence alignment program that aligns DNA or
mRNA sequences against a large reference database. Mappy provides a
convenient interface to minimap2.

dependencies.name: py-cffi
dependencies.description: Foreign Function Interface for Python calling C code

dependencies.name: py-edlib
dependencies.description:
Lightweight, super fast library for sequence alignment using edit
(Levenshtein) distance.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-intervaltree
dependencies.description: Editable interval tree data structure for Python 2 and 3.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-ont-fast5-api
dependencies.description:
This project provides classes and utility functions for working with
read fast5 files. It provides an abstraction layer between the
underlying h5py library and the various concepts central to read fast5
files, such as "reads", "analyses", "analysis summaries", and "analysis
datasets". Ideally all interaction with a read fast5 file should be
possible via this API, without having to directly invoke the h5py
library.

dependencies.name: py-parasail
dependencies.description:
Python Bindings for the Parasail C Library. Parasail is a SIMD C (C99)
library containing implementations of the Smith-Waterman (local),
Needleman-Wunsch (global), and semi-global pairwise sequence alignment
algorithms.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pysam
dependencies.description: A python module for reading, manipulating and writing genomic data sets.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-tensorflow
dependencies.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.

dependencies.name: samtools
dependencies.description:
SAM Tools provide various utilities for manipulating alignments in the
SAM format, including sorting, merging, indexing and generating
alignments in a per-position format
